page.title: 19CUSTOMS - NURSERY RHYME
page.content: Kilmersdon has one traditional story. The steep lane leading up from the village to the school is known as Jack and Jill hill, and there at the top is a well. No claim of any other site will be accepted by the true Kilmersdonian. To prove it they quote the large number of families with the surname "Gilson" in the area. Jack and Jill were not children but man and wife. "Jill's son" founded the family of Gilson which has flourished ever since. If further proof were needed, there in the valley is a cottage known as Tumbler's Bottom where poor Jack finally came to rest. On this theme an annual village day is planned. (Ref: Howell - "Round here, in them days", l980)
